articles.headline: Chris Christie Makes Steady Rightward Shift on Guns
articles.snippet: Governor Christie, who first won office saying he would toughen laws regulating firearms, has used his recent record in New Jersey to recast himself as a champion of the Second Amendment.
articles.abstract: Governor Christie, who first won office saying he would toughen laws regulating firearms, has used his recent record in New Jersey to recast himself as a champion of the Second Amendment.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Democratic attack ad from 2009 showed Chris Christie’s face beside a row of bullets, branding him as an ally of the National Rifle Association. A narrator warned that unlike Jon S. Corzine, a Democrat who was then New Jersey’s governor, Mr. Christie “stands with the N.R.A. and opposes banning armor-piercing rifles.”

articles.headline: Oil Prices Slide Again, and the Bottom Is Not Yet in Sight
articles.snippet: Oil futures have dropped every day of the year so far because of slumping demand, and analysts say the trend is likely to continue.
articles.abstract: Oil futures have dropped every day of the year so far because of slumping demand, and analysts say the trend is likely to continue.
articles.lead_paragraph: The continuing collapse in commodity prices pushed oil futures still lower Monday, and analysts predicted that the slide was far from over.

articles.headline: A New Focus on Liquidity After a Fund’s Collapse
articles.snippet: It has been a searing few months for Third Avenue Management, which shut down its junk bond fund when investors demanded payouts that far exceeded available funds.
articles.abstract: It has been a searing few months for Third Avenue Management, which shut down its junk bond fund when investors demanded payouts that far exceeded available funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: The college seminar was drawing to a close in October and Martin J. Whitman was pondering the hits and misses in his long career at the top of Third Avenue Management, one of Wall Street’s better-known value investment firms.

articles.headline: Golden Globes Reflect a New Trajectory for TV
articles.snippet: The Golden Globe awards rewarded shows outside the norms of television-success formulas, giving the nod to offbeat, even dark productions.
articles.abstract: The Golden Globe awards rewarded shows outside the norms of television-success formulas, giving the nod to offbeat, even dark productions.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. — Over the last decade, NBC Universal’s cable chief, Bonnie Hammer, has occasionally visited the Golden Globes under less-than-glamorous conditions: sitting in a production truck for the E! network, dressed in jeans and sneakers, with her hair pulled back. By time the network wrapped up its red carpet show and the show actually began, a limo would be summoned, a pizza ordered and Ms. Hammer’s night would be all but over.

articles.headline: Automakers Go Electric, Even if Gas Is Cheap
articles.snippet: Low gas prices have meant healthy sales of trucks and S.U.V.s, but automakers are looking ahead to stricter fuel economy rules by showcasing electric and hybrid models.
articles.abstract: Low gas prices have meant healthy sales of trucks and S.U.V.s, but automakers are looking ahead to stricter fuel economy rules by showcasing electric and hybrid models.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — While American consumers were taking advantage of low gas prices to buy trucks and sport utility vehicles in large numbers, some automakers delayed investing in slower-selling electrified vehicles.

articles.headline: When Restless Billionaires Trip on Their Toys
articles.snippet: The Facebook co-founder trying to unload The New Republic is hardly the only billionaire to reach beyond his grasp.
articles.abstract: The Facebook co-founder trying to unload The New Republic is hardly the only billionaire to reach beyond his grasp.
articles.lead_paragraph: “If you really care about an institution and want to make it strong for the ages, you don’t walk out. You roll up your sleeves, you redouble your commitment to those ideals in a changing world, and you fight.”

articles.headline: El Chapo Case Draws Mexico Closer to U.S.
articles.snippet: Joaquín Guzmán Loera’s escape from prison helped shrink the distance between Mexico and the United States, creating a sense of shared urgency that had not existed in years.
articles.abstract: Joaquín Guzmán Loera’s escape from prison helped shrink the distance between Mexico and the United States, creating a sense of shared urgency that had not existed in years.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Mexico has started letting American agents carry guns on its soil. A special Mexican unit trained by Americans has been revived after stalling because of mistrust and a sense of national pride. American agents are working with Mexican soldiers to seize guns, and the two nations just agreed on a plan to tackle the heroin epidemic.

articles.headline: Balancing Terror and Reality in State of the Union Address
articles.snippet: When President Obama speaks to Congress on Tuesday night, he will offer reassurance on the country’s efforts against terrorism, but he is said to believe that the sense of danger has been inflated.
articles.abstract: When President Obama speaks to Congress on Tuesday night, he will offer reassurance on the country’s efforts against terrorism, but he is said to believe that the sense of danger has been inflated.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Obama speaks to the nation in his final State of the Union address on Tuesday night, he will offer a familiar reassurance that the country is expending enormous effort to protect Americans against international terrorism.

articles.headline: Hillary Clinton Races to Close Enthusiasm Gap With Bernie Sanders in Iowa
articles.snippet: With voters mobbing Mr. Sanders at events in the state, exposing a disparity in passion for the two Democrats, Mrs. Clinton has gone on the attack and tried to energize supporters.
articles.abstract: With voters mobbing Mr. Sanders at events in the state, exposing a disparity in passion for the two Democrats, Mrs. Clinton has gone on the attack and tried to energize supporters.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Iowa Democrats are displaying far less passion for Hillary Clinton than for Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont three weeks before the presidential caucuses, creating anxiety inside the Clinton campaign as she scrambles to energize supporters and to court wavering voters.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Yamiche Alcindor

articles.headline: ‘Sesame Street’ Gets New Upscale Look for HBO Premiere
articles.snippet: Oscar the Grouch has a recycling bin and Big Bird has moved to a tree as the children’s classic debuts on HBO, aiming at a generation that doesn’t distinguish between TV and mobile screens.
articles.abstract: Oscar the Grouch has a recycling bin and Big Bird has moved to a tree as the children’s classic debuts on HBO, aiming at a generation that doesn’t distinguish between TV and mobile screens.
articles.lead_paragraph: Big Bird’s nest has moved to a tree. Elmo has moved from an apartment into a brownstone. His best friend, Abby Cadabby, loves her new community garden. And while Oscar the Grouch still makes a trash can his home, he now pops up through an underground tunnel of connecting recycling and compost bins.
